item.title: Auto Cabin Pressure Control Systems – Both Auto Systems Inoperative – Manual System Inoperative

numlitem.para: Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited,

For passenger, combi, STCs ST01529SE and ST01920LA freighters, procedures are established and used to ensure the lower cargo compartments remain empty or are verified to contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), and/or Fly Away Kits, and

For STC ST03562AT procedures are established and used to ensure upper and lower cargo compartments remain empty or are verified to contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), and/or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: Single Pack operation is required for all phases of the flight.
With ACMs on board, en route altitude is limited to 10,000 ft.
After takeoff and with obstacle clearance assured, limit aircraft climb and descent rates to avoid ACM discomfort.

limitation.para: Maximum altitude limited to 15,000 ft. MSL.

numlitem.para: At cabin pressure altitude above 10,000 ft., up to and including 12,000 ft., oxygen must be provided for and used by each member of the flight crew on flight deck duty and must be provided for other crewmembers for that part of the flight at those altitudes that is of more than 30 minutes duration.
Extended overwater flights at a horizontal distance of more than 50NM from the nearest shoreline are prohibited.

note.para: Required crew only if planned flight altitude exceeds 10,000 ft. MSL.

numlitem.para: At cabin pressure altitudes above 12,000 ft., oxygen must be provided for and used by each member of the flight crew on flight deck duty and must be provided for other crewmembers during entire flight at those altitudes.
A minimum of 2 hours of oxygen per crewmember on board.

table.title: CREW OXYGEN MINIMUM DISPATCH PRESSURE (2 HOUR RULE)

placard.para: Placard Cabin Altitude Control Mode Sel "AUTO 1 and AUTO 2 INOP" and enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Manual positioning of the outflow valve.

numlitem.para: Open and collar CABIN ALTITUDE CONTROL MANUAL circuit breaker (11B14).
Open aft cargo door and remove aft end liner.
Disconnect outflow valve actuator connector rod from the actuator drive arm. Tag and stow connector rod in PFM.
Remove connecting pin from outflow valve hold open tool (A21008-2). Install tool halves to outflow valve linkage and to surrounding structure.

Adjust rod end of hold open tool until distance between outflow valve flappers is 1.5 +/- 0.1 inches when tool is connected. Install connecting pin in hold open tool. Lock wire attach bolt and thumbscrew.
Install cargo compartment end liner panel and close aft cargo door.
Open and collar the CABIN ALTITUDE CONTROL AUTO 1 (11N15) AND CABIN ALTITUDE CONTROL AUTO 2 (11N24) circuit breakers.
Place Cabin Altitude Control MODE SEL switch to either AUTO 1 or AUTO 2.
Open a "D" item DMI to track the remove outflow valve actuator connector rod.
